name: Three Abbey Green

reviews.title: self -- cater Apartments-- WONDERFUL
reviews.text: consider their self catering flats. Take a stroll, eat great food, listen to even song in the Abbey -- and stop back at your own place for tea or toast with champagne. We did both celebrating our 40th anniversary. I highly recommend it

This is an absolutely terrific place! When we first arrived, Sue sat us down, encouraged us to relax, and ran through a number of options for evening meals, entertainment, and the like. She then took us up to the room, which was large, light, and airy. During our stay there, everyone was as friendly and helpful as one could wish. The extremely tasty breakfasts were made to order, tailored to each guest's preference. We had been traveling for almost 3 weeks by the time we got to Bath, and during that time we had stayed in some marvelous places. 3 Abbey Green, however, was my daughter's absolute favorite--she didn't want to go! Thanks for a wonderful stay! Robin and Anna
reviews.title: 3 Abbey Green is a great place!

likes.disliked: — It couldn't have been improved on, really.

reviews.text: Our five night stay was ful of wonderful suprises. The first wonderful surprise was the locationk right in the middle of the action, but secluded from the traffic of cars and people. It couldn't be better. The second wonderful suprise was the personal attention received from Sue, Derek & Nicci. They were great, helpful when needed but giving us the privacy of a hotel. Perfect Combination. The third great surprise where the rooms, they were large and very comfortable. I loved them. Overall our experience couldn't have been better. I recommend the accomodations to anyone.
reviews.title: BEST ADDRESS IN BATH

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Four nights as guests of Sue, Derek and Nicci were a delight. The gracious owners provide hospitality with a capital "aitch". When the previous guests had damaged our scheduled suite, we were given the option to move into one of the apartment units which they maintain a block away. Breakfasts were delicious. Rooms and public areas were very clean. Sue was always helpful with advice and tips on restaurants and other tourist logistics. The lodging is very handy being situated several blocks from the train and bus stations and one block from the baths and Abbey church. We hope to return soon.
reviews.title: Real hospitality!

likes.liked: — Clean, very well furnished, gracious hosts

reviews.title: Penthouse, Abbey Heights
reviews.text: The apartment is fantastic - great location - all rooms and facilities are top notch, and the kitchen gadgets are redolent of the Jetsons. Very strongly recommended - I know our friends who had rooms at Three very much enjoyed their stay too.

Our family of five stayed at Three Abbey Green for three nights in March 2008. We were very pleased with our choice. The location is excellent; so close to shopping and all the major sights and the guest house itself is exactly as advertised. Though they don't have their own parking, using the public carpark only a couple of blocks away was easy--really not a problem at all.
reviews.title: Wonderful Family Stay

reviews.text: When we arrived Nici spent a long while orienting us to Bath going over the map of the city and pointing out suitable restaurants for our family (Martini's serves delicious Italian food including enormous pizzas).
reviews.title: Great location, great accommodation - we will be back
Perfect Location, Beautiful Rooms, Wonderful Breakfast
reviews.text: Our room (Lord Nelson) was perfect for us--the teenagers had their own small room and our youngest stayed in the main room with us which had plenty of space for the three of us. (In fact, every room we saw when the doors were open for cleaning was lovely and spacious.) The breakfasts were great---fresh and home-cooked and the hosts were extremely accomodating. They obviously really enjoy what they do. They are friendly and helpful without being cloying or overbearing. We highly recommend Three Abbey Green.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have just returned from a two night stay for a "girlie" break (4 of us).
reviews.title: Wow, wow, wow

reviews.text: The accommodation was exactly as described on the website. Lovely, character rooms - clean, comfortable, lovely and warm, attention to detail in the decor and complete with alarm clock and ear plugs! (The only negative comment I could possibly make about this place was the noise from late night revellers - not the fault of our hosts and the price one pays for being in the centre of things). Great breakfast too, with the usual fruit , cereal and a good choice of cooked options.
reviews.title: Weekend break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at the Three Abbey Green. The room was large and comfortable and the location was fabulous for the town of Bath. They thought about the potential noise in the room and provided ear plugs, which was thoughtful. The bathroom was not too modern, but it had the amenities we needed.
reviews.title: Comfortable Location in Bath

reviews.text: Breakfast was good, with a little menu so that everyone had what they wanted to have.
reviews.title: Great location, Good Value & Hosts who work hard to anticipate your needs

reviews.text: Room: Lady Hamilton – street level - by front door. Painted mint green with white trim work. Simply furnished. Cozy white duvet on extra firm king bed (2 twins). Gold curtains on huge windows let in lots of light . 2 small club chairs. Dresser & closet. Small TV with 5 – 7 stations. Fireplace w mantel (didn’t explore if functioning). Very clean. Would ask for a higher floor during my next stay.
reviews.title: wonderful home from home

reviews.text: Nice touches: electrical adaptors, hair dryers, daily tea & coffee & cookies left in your room. Free / accessible internet access.
reviews.title: Relaxing weekend in lovely surroundings at Three Abbey Green

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bathroom: large bathroom with a stand up shower & towel warmer. Basic large towels. Special tips for Americans: byo wash clothes – not uncommon in EU, however, the other inn & hotel we stayed in did have them. If blow drying your hair is part of your morning routine, you won’t be able to do it in the bathroom (same at other hotels where we stayed in the UK), it's easy enough to find a plug elsewhere in your room near a mirror.
reviews.title: A Perfect Vacation Experience

reviews.text: After reading all the positive reviews on Three Abbey Green, we were really looking forward to our visit. The location is perfect, the breakfasts were good and the room was large and nicely furnished.

description: Three Abbey Green is a Four Star Gold Award guest house, hidden away in a quiet cobbled square in the heart of central Bath. A stone's throw from the Abbey and Roman Baths, everything you could wish to see is on your doorstep. A leisurely walk to the Royal Crescent and King's Circus takes in an eclectic mix of boutique, independent and big-name shops, street performers and stunning Georgian architecture along the way. And when you get there, don't forget to visit the Assembly Rooms - ladies, no visit would be complete without trying on a corset and crinoline at the Fashion Museum. Whether you're here to relax at the Thermae Bath Spa, take in a little culture at the Theatre Royal, or shout yourself hoarse in support of your team at the Bath Rugby ground, Three Abbey Green is ideally situated for everything Bath has to offer.A Grade 2 listed building, parts of which date back to 1689, the main house has seven rooms (including two large suites ideal for families or groups), each with its own character and unique charm. Period features such as original fireplaces and wood panelled walls fit comfortably with tasteful contemporary furnishings. Greet the morning with an award winning breakfast, packed full of local produce. Don't worry if you have dietary needs - we can meet them all, given a little notice! As part of our commitment to expanding upon the service we currently provide, we are extending our award-winning bed and breakfast, Three Abbey Green, into the beautiful Georgian maisonette next door (which was once Four Abbey Green apartment).
